review: good game

i bought this game because i liked geneforge which is a great game this one just doesnt seem to have the same spark nothing about the story  setting pulled me in or exited me arrow keys are used to scroll  there is no way to rebind them

exactly what i needed  a storyheavy rpg fix with a utilitarian ui geared towards reading wellwritten dialogues and plot and reasonably indepth combat and progression systems ive only scratched the surface of the tale  hopefully it will live up to the expectations and provide hours of immersive play and reading material so far after 3 hours im enjoying it immensely
i love this game
spiderweb software simply never misses much love jeff vogel  crew

the avadon trilogy starting off with avadon the black fortress is another gem by spiderweb software its not my favorite by them but its still a very solid one where you play an enforcer part of a larger ruling system called avadon and are given quite a lot of power to make choices and tough calls it follows the spiderweb software formula to a tee being another retrostyle rpg with plenty of turnbased combat but theres still a lot of cool fun and charm to be had here

i gave this game a second try but the pace is just too slow there is much text in the game and after finishing the tutorial and going into the first mission you are thrown without direction of where to go  if you enjoy reading a lot and talking to every npc in a game i would def suggest this game otherwise just pass it
excellent writing from spiderweb software as usual
old graphics great gameplay and story hidden gem
a pretty charming and fun game
avadon
i really enjoy these games  they are old school fun  a lot of text in this one  huge story line  i am enjoying it immensely   runs very smooth on my new imac as well
the game is deep but i eventually was put off  bored the art style

spiderweb software games are always fun to play and this game is no different although avadon was released in 2011 it still has playability today avadon as with other spiderweb games is heavily linear and storydriven
good lengthy crpg

the storyline is good but this is a very old school rpg which lacks much of the quality of life features what shines is its good storyline and the moral choices to be made it is trying to tell you what you see or hear may not always be the whole truth anyway i do enjoy it till the last area where all the enemies got haste  thats a bit ridiculous i give it a 710 rating

solid rpg youre not playing for the graphics or sound but the story which is really well done  that said you can bump up the graphics to 4k using an app called lossless scaling on steam i set the ingame graphics to 1920 x 1024 and then set lossless scalings scaling mode to custom with a scale factor of 2 looks perfect in 4k
nice game
engaging story line and interesting characters it is text heavy but if you like storyrich games then that shouldnt be a problem spiderweb software made some my favorite games growing up

i was a massive fan of jeffs early work back in the 90s and 00s but somehow his more recent work has lost me and im at a bit of a loss to figure out why maybe just the competitive landscape and tastes shifting
good little game
decent oldschool rpg
decent oldschool rpg but not quite enough to replay the beginning after losing my save files in a hard drive crash no cloud saves

a really unpleasant game that leaves a bad feel it doesnt really pose moral questions but just wallows in amorality in bizarre situations any game that judges morality has to actually decide what the consequences in the game will be so its never neutral and you shouldnt learn your morality from video game designers
the quality of every other game produced by spiderweb software is enough to assure everyone familiar with them that avadon  the black fortress will be an exceptionally fun and engaging experience

spiderwebs games always have a lot of depth to them and avadon is no different  it was one of the first games from the developer that i played and while i havent finished it yet it keeps drawing me back to it  would always recommend any of their games for someone who likes storydriven games

i completed the game on easy mode and for a newbie like me it was still not easy the music and sound effects are boring the story is pretty good i enjoyed the characters and this game tops the cake for overuse of bosses it feels that for every 3 fights one of them is a boss

if you like spider web studio games here is another one for you to play as usual there will be way too much reading but a lot to see and do in an open world fantasy squad rpg since you can skip a lot of the reading i found it a nice diversion at least for a while
decisions in gameplay that determine different outcomes according to the answers and choices enormous world to explore intriguing plots and theme
good oldschool rpg with surprisingly impactful choices to make
clicks all the buttons for old scholl top down rpg
if you are looking for oldschool turnbased combat and ultima style gameplay youve found a good home here
not too far into the game yet but so far i like the world and story even more than the avernum games has a slight wheel of timefeel but in a good way
old school game  lots of fun

avadon is a very simple rpg game for its design  although a bit dated and somewhat basic in appearance the gameplay is easy to get into including the turnbased combat and the game world is nice to explore and backtrack to at times  even though the story feels a little weak and theres a lack of music to entertain you its a fairly decent title and worth a try
ive played before and thoroughly enjoyed the game
good addition to the spiderweb series of games i enjoyed this crpg enough for a second playthrough which is a lot for me
awesome game everyone should play
the deserved successor of avernum

i played this a long time ago and feel obligated to review this now   it has a good plot intrigue moral dilemmas and a nice fantasy world setup lore is interesting game mechanics is decent i enjoyed this and recommend it despite me giving its sequel a thumbs down you can refer to that if interested

i wont lie  it took me a while to try this game because of the offputting visuals once i gave it some time though it grew on me its a contemplative game deliberate slow and text heavy theres lots of little jokes strewn about and jeff vogels sense of humor shows in some of the dialog despite the otherwise very serious tone of the story ill have to look at some of his other work now

an old school classic that has a solid gameplay foundation the true gem though is the complicated story politics are intertwined that pose challenging moral questions your answers actually dictate the outcome of quests the deeper you get into the game the more dangerous and sinister the world becomes good luck you will need it because anything higher than normal difficulty in this game is challenging
classic rpg
i played this out of respect for spiderwebs old games but lot a lot of that respect in the process there are better osrs out there with far better systems
spiderweb has come a long way since its humble beginnings in avernum and it shows
good old school times
cool old school gamer
fun old school rpg

rather an average game this i had a fun few hours with it before my interest waned but underneath those dated looks is a rather dated game  the visuals are very retro and there are some nice details after a few hours however i lost interest there just wasnt enough to hold me die hards of the genre only

if there is one game that has been the bane of my life it would be this one can never seem to finish this one something always comes up at least it is a hidden gem and well worth playing if your into the grand rpg thing
this guy has been making indie rpgs for a long time he does great work he deserves recognition
great oldschool rpg

if you go in just expecting a fun retro crpg with a good story you wont be disappointed  if you are used to graphics and hardcore options you wont find them here  the gameplay is simple and reasonably intuitive  i was a fan of the old ultima series and found this was somewhat similar
get the series one of the best i played from these guys
solid crpg
great old school rpg

i really liked the amount and depth of the story with many twists and turns as well as the companion mechanics in this game the medieval setting isnt usually my bag of tea but the political dynamics waved into the plot between the different kingdoms made it very interesting i also liked the tactical gameplay and i personally really like the art style too
awesome old school crpg like the rest of spiderweb games
this game is super good and i played it and it was fun and good to play
its just like avernum
highly rewarding experience wellwritten welldesigned the only thing i needed to change was sound off and put on some other music
love the story line  characters  didnt always agree with some of the decisions i had to make or the outcomes but thats how games roll
epic game with interesting plot and boss battles so far the best rpg that ive ever played

ive been a fan of jeffs games for a long time but ive always treated them with a passive interest not so anymore since playing queens wish ive been focusing on his other games avadon is such a beautifully developed game even if not artistically relevant with a rich story and lore if you enjoy rpgs with depth you will enjoy this dont hesitate buy this fall in love and buy the rest of the trilogy
a good game worth buying
good rpg great story retro gameplay remind you that you dont need aaa graphics to do a good game

i like the choose your own adventure style and the game play is slow but reliable i recommend it well for the limitations of my computer and others who cant make massive data commitments to a true mmorpg
not my cup of tea  i think for me the most important thing that pushed me away from the game was the absolute lack of visual appeal

i felt the ultimalike design and approach were a bit too dated ui graphics engine etc are all straight out of the late 90s or early 2000s rpgs like ultima or even similar to other modern topdown like the age of decadence  unfortunately while there is a lot here for fans of a specific niche  i dont think general audiences of 2020 would find much to enjoy i enjoyed bits here and there but overall couldnt get into a stride that felt right  or at least thats my take
as always great classic rpg from spiderweb software 8510

havent played much yet but im really enjoying myself so far i kind of like the graphics they have an oldschool look but the sound design isnt very good this is the first rpg game of this style that ive played i didnt think id be able to get into it but im really liking it  you may have to run the game at a lower resolution though as at 1080p the graphics are a bit small

would never have guessed how much fun id get outta this oldschool rpg but especially at the beginning the story is surprisingly compactly told and instead of boring me to death im thrilled to become a mighty knight  holds up surprisingly well although little rusty mechanicswise
amazing

its a fun old schoolstyle crpg made in the distinct spiderweb software style i enjoyed it but i found it too linear and combatbased with the exception of a few the separate choices you can make dont really make a difference outside of different quest rewards or getting no rewards at all

really fun oldschool crpg with a turnbased aspect this game was ahead of its time many hours of gameplay you will need to reed the talk screens in order to follow the story not many cutscenes  that is a small drawback of it but not a deal breaker truly amazing game
spirit of old school as is
for avadon

like other spiderweb games this game shows the creators love for his world and the details excellent story history and compelling gameplay if you like turn based rpgs that show more concern for story than fps youll love this game

i would say after reading pinky review its clear crystal that someone actually noticed the correct things this game aint fitting to 2019 and no its not worth it even for nostalgia if you remember this game as a good game then just stick with that feeling and dont bother to test it if you feel its awful well youre right its awful 310 oh no here comes angry comments
too much combatoriented
fun and varied with plenty of good writing and loot its fun to play most issues that plagued the previous games the avernum series are now fixed
good story good gameplay etc would heavily reccomend
good old styled ultima like rpg  weird ginger mega boss
great rpg experience with a good bit of challenge to it

a traditional isometric fantasy rpg set in a unique world you play as an agent of avadon a peace keeping organization that maintains a strict alliance between multiple nations in the pact against the farlands its your job to respond to requests from the pact nations to maintain political ties slay dangerous beasts investigate suspicious individuals  solve a variety of other issues

unfortunately the game is simply boring it is behind the market on multiple levels  linear offering no choices combat is weak and boring there are no interesting skills or items no engaging mechanics the world is generic its time to face the truth  avernum was 20 years ago and spiderweb made very little progress since then
lots of walking back and forth which takes up time and repetitive battles writing is pretty standard but its enjoyable enough to play i just like collecting new loot

if youre a fan of party based stat heavy rpgs dont let the indie esthetic turn you off from what is a surprisingly deep game with an interesting and complex storyline that offers choice where the difference between good and bad is not so clear

the game does not offer the same amount of freedom as other spiderweb games as a matter of fact it is almost 100 linear but it definitely has its merits in the deftly crafted world and lore and the gameplay is all meat  gripping from start to finish
at first it did not seem much  but it is a good game there are some flaws graphics are ugly no music  still oldschool rpg fans will like it

avadon the black fortress is a fantastic crpg styled after oldschool games of yore such as baldurs gate while the gameplay may add nothing notable to the genre it is fast fun intuitive and easy to pick up as for the story it takes more inspiration from 70s medieval pulp than high fantasy which is entirely welcome im looking forward to the tens of hours im sure i will put into this game

the avernum series is like watching game of thrones on tv  the avadon series is like reading the books  while avernum is somewhat predictable avadon is just full of twists and turns  1010 would play again

good rpg shorter and less options for partycharacter creation than others from the same developer but it also made the game more storydriven and linear its not a bad thing but it is different from avernum or geneforge in that sense once again this game requires an imagination and love of reading to enjoy
1 rpg

recommended to players who like reading a good story  there is much to read many popup windows of text are present in this game  if reading is fundamental to a life well lived then avadon puts the ufunu in fundamental

a very good game at old school style it is very interesting almost like old dd games baldurs gate iwd etc but with specific skilltree and many different combat parameters very hard and challenging fights i am played on the torment difficulty from the start and that was painfully hard that was true challenge and i like it very good game for peoples who miss old games with their hardnest and dont care about ugly isometric graphic

it plays exactly like it looks though depends on the type of eyes you got if you are born premilennial and liked nethergate or other oldschool revivals if you did game in the old days you will love it with its graphics and mechanics it manages to bring up this special feeling  if you are born after the year 2000 and are used to play highend graphics and that you may not like it although it is a good game like chess
great story felt very involved  i ended up caring about the characters  it has an old school feel to it but im happy enough with that if the narrative is this good  excellent value

avadon is from spiderweb softwares who made geneforge and avernum pretty awesome series of games and avadon while some might be less fan of it is still great in its genre and is worth playing lets show redbeard some feats

you have to be someone who is okay with reading a lot of dialogue to get the full enjoyment out of this if you have some patience at first it seems to be a very intresting game  some of the dialogue was funny

goddamn iti hate steam doesnt reflect my time played it doesnt though this was one of my im on a shitty laptop with no internet games i love it there is so much to it if you like oldschool rpgs especially fftstyle ones give this a go
another wonderfully unique wellwritten rpg from spiderweb software keep up the good work guys

amazing oldschool turn based isometric rpg but what else is there to expect from spiderweb great writing decent gameplay and a gripping story and narrative if youre into one spiderweb game then just get them all theyre all great

unlike a lot of people i am not bothered by the new skill system when compared to avernum or geneforge but after playing so many spiderweb games they all start to blend into each other i got bored about halfway through and it became a chore to finish the game  not recommended  610

feels old school not a bad thing just feels dated  but the story is great  i cant quite explain it but its got a nostalgic feel except its as good as you remember those times being and not the garbage you usually find when you go back to the past  i cant believe i got this gem for 3

enjoyable old school game swift combat mechanic a plus even with many enemies lack of background music is a minus well written dialogue and location descriptions a plus low grade graphics not a problem lots of roaming fine skill trees a plus minor crafting system okay variety of weapons and armor not bad original not so much scratches that old school itch id say so overall enjoyable  worth the price in my opinion  a steal if on sale lots to discover and explore
its like a classic isometric rpg but new its not bad but for those not familiar with games in the vein of baldurs gate it may take some getting used too
this game takes me to flavortown

classical rpg at its best turn based battles lots of dialogues and a long story pretty fun though the battles so far are very easy the graphics are crude but they work fine the developer could improve this by hiring better artists

writing this right after beating avadon 2 this one has a better story the combat is more balanced and the characters are better written worth a playthru if you like avernum but want more linear character buildsclasses
